intro: Wikstroemia monnula var. monnula, commonly known as the Hawaiian sandalwood, is a shrub native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
